main event: An Air National Guard pilot sighted two shiny globes connected by a solid rod in Angoon, Alaska, on December 6, 1950.
interesting points: The pilot observed the objects moving in a southerly direction at high speed of approximately 3000 mph,The objects were circular in shape with an estimated diameter of 150 feet,The pilot was unable to distinguish any lights, vapor trails, or exhaust smoke from the objects,The sighting lasted approximately 1.5 minutes,The report suggests similarities to known upper air search balloons but lacks sufficient data for a definitive conclusion.
sighted object: two shiny globes connected by a solid rod
